snippet: Gyasi Zardes scored two goals, the second on a penalty in the 94th minute, and the Columbus Crew beat the Montreal Impact 3-2 on Saturday.

headline.main: Zardes' Late Goal Lifts Crew Over Impact 3-2
headline.print_headline: Zardes' Late Goal Lifts Crew Over Impact 3-2

snippet: A narrow strip of blue has stretched for more than 150 miles (nearly 200 kilometers) across the nation of Bolivia as part of a demonstration of the country's demand for an outlet to the sea.

headline.main: Bolivians Stretch Vast Flag in Demand for Sea Outlet
headline.print_headline: Bolivians Stretch Vast Flag in Demand for Sea Outlet

snippet: In Japan, a girl turns to her Buddhist faith to help rebuild her village temple destroyed in the tsunami seven years ago.

headline.main: A Young Monk Finds Her Calling

snippet: They need to see themselves reflected in stories that celebrate everyday beauty.

headline.main: Black Kids Don’t Want to Read About Harriet Tubman All the Time
headline.print_headline: She Wants More Than M.L.K. at Bedtime

snippet: The overture to Emmet T. Flood appears to be an acknowledgment that the special counsel investigation is unlikely to end anytime soon.

headline.main: Trump Talks With Clinton Impeachment Lawyer About Aiding in Mueller Response
headline.print_headline: Trump Talks With Clinton Impeachment Lawyer About Aiding in Mueller Response

byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

snippet: Championship leaders Wolverhampton Wanderers' promotion charge was halted as Midlands rivals Aston Villa handed out a 4-1 thrashing at a spirited Villa Park on Saturday.

headline.main: Villa Beat Wolves to Boost Promotion Hopes
headline.print_headline: Villa Beat Wolves to Boost Promotion Hopes

snippet: Paris St Germain got back to business in Ligue 1 after being knocked out of the Champions League by Real Madrid in midweek, hammering basement club Metz 5-0 at home and stretching their lead at the top of the standings back to 14 points.

headline.main: PSG Thrash Struggling Metz After European Exit
headline.print_headline: PSG Thrash Struggling Metz After European Exit

snippet: Can the reckoning reach all the way into the Oval?
An article about a woman who refused offers of help raises issues about mental illness and consent.

headline.main: Trying to Help a Homeless Woman
headline.print_headline: Trying to Help a Homeless Woman

snippet: Officials in Tulsa County, Oklahoma, have agreed to pay a record $6 million to the estate of an unarmed black man who was fatally shot in 2015 by a white volunteer sheriff's deputy who thought his pistol was a Taser, federal court documents showed...

headline.main: Estate of Oklahoma Man Killed by Reserve Deputy to Receive $6 Million
headline.print_headline: Estate of Oklahoma Man Killed by Reserve Deputy to Receive $6 Million
